p: Interestingly, the ASP's workload was maintained despite lower admission numbers and bed occupancy: 2542 audits were performed pre-COVID-19 and 2689 audits were performed during the COVID-19 period. The details and clinical impact of the ASP interventions are detailed in Table 1 . In essence, there was no significant difference in intervention acceptance rates between the two groups. The impact of ASP interventions was sustained during the COVID-19 period, with a significant reduction in the duration of antibiotic therapy and length of hospital stay in cases where ASP interventions were accepted. Such beneficial outcomes potentially alleviated the problem of ‘bed crunch’ during the pandemic.
